description: Repositioning of existing extract ventilation duct on side wall, to be relocated through side roofslope of restaurant premises
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR35 Leq, 5mins, for plant which will operate during the period of 2300 - 0700 hrs weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays, NR40 Leq, 1hr for plant which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700-2300hrs Mondays to Fridays, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together.  Details as approved shall be implemented and permanently retained.  REASON:  In the interests of living and working conditions of nearby occupiers, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policy B8, Replacement UDP Policy 4.11. | Before the development is commenced, the ventilation duct from the commercial premises, shall be fixed to the wall of the dwelling with suitable anti-vibration isolators and the fan motor shall be vibration isolated from the duct, so as to satisfy an acoustic standard of not exceeding NR25 (Leq 5mins) inside a habitable room.  REASON:  In the interests of living conditions of nearby occupiers, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policy B8, Replacement UDP Policy 4.11.
